organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: " Our countries ' leaders have agreed to meet in March , 1997 .

Let's think step by step.

The "Organization" entities in the paragraph are:

1. "countries" (plural) - refers to the nations or states that are involved in the agreement to meet.
2. "leaders" (plural) - refers to the individuals or groups that represent the countries and have the authority to make decisions on their behalf.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Organization.

Sure, my apologies for the mistake. Here are the entities that clearly refer to an organization in the paragraph:

1. "countries" (plural) - refers to the nations or states that are involved in the agreement to meet.

The entity "leaders" (plural) can be removed as it does not necessarily refer to an organization, but rather to individual leaders or representatives of the countries.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Organization".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here are the valid entities in a Markdown table with one column "Organization":

| Organization |
| --- |
| countries |

The entity "countries" (plural) refers to the nations or states that are involved in the agreement to meet.
